definition: lit. to invert root and branch (idiom); fig. confusing cause and effect/to stress the incidental over the fundamental/to put the cart before the horse
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
tip/end/final stage/latter part/inessential detail/powder/dust/opera role of old man
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to install/to place/to put/to buy

sentences.english: In his view, people spend far too much time putting the cart before the horse.
sentences.chinese: 在他來看，人們老是本末倒置。

sentences.english: That man has reversed Genesis- man has make God to his image and likeness.
sentences.chinese: 人卻本末倒置，以自己的形像塑造天主。

sentences.english: Construction in the field have to understand before proportions.
sentences.chinese: 建設部在房價的認識上已經到了本末倒置的地步。

sentences.english: There’s certainly nothingrational about putting the cart before the horse.
sentences.chinese: 本末倒置當然沒有任何理性可言。

sentences.english: Yet perhaps there's an upside to all of this.
We shouldn't put the cart before the horses.
You are simply putting the cart before the horse!
sentences.chinese: 你這根本就是本末倒置嘛。

sentences.english: But to blame the service for infidelity is to confuse cause and effect.
sentences.chinese: 但將夫妻不忠歸罪在線約會則是本末倒置了。

sentences.english: In the meantime, make sure your hands do not upstage your ideas.
sentences.chinese: 在這同時，注意不要使打手勢和表達思想本末倒置。

definition: to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
to let go of the big prize while grabbing at trifles (idiom)
pinyin: jian3 le5 zhi1 ma5 diu1 le5 xi1 gua1

definition: seeking instant benefit (idiom); shortsighted vision, looking only for fast return
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
blindly/invariably
to lack foresight
to save a little only to lose a lot (idiom)
to take sth for granted
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
careless/any-old-how, regardless of the specific task
pinyin: mei2 mao5 hu2 zi5 yi1 ba3 zhua1

definition: lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
to reverse cause and effect/to put the horse before the cart
to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it
pinyin: hua4 hu3 bu4 cheng2 fan3 lei4 quan3

definition: to buy a wooden box and return the pearls inside/to show poor judgment (idiom)
